summary: This is an email from a Deputy Chief in the Criminal Division of the Southern District of New York, sent the day after Ghislaine Maxwell's sentencing. It discusses coordinating with the FBI regarding information on Maxwell's current accounts to assist in recovering a fine imposed as part of her sentence.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the email references her sentence, and the communication is about recovering a fine imposed on her as part of that sentence.

events.title: Maxwell Sentencing
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was sentenced, which included the imposition of a fine.

keyFacts: The email is dated June 29, 2022, the day after Ghislaine Maxwell's sentencing.
The communication is from a Deputy Chief in the SDNY Criminal Division, indicating high-level DOJ involvement in post-sentencing financial recovery.
The purpose is to coordinate with the FBI to use information about Maxwell's 'current accounts' to recover a court-imposed fine.
The document shows active post-conviction efforts by the government to secure financial penalties from Maxwell.
